Lead by Example If you used two actions, Strike the target. You gain a status bonus to the damage roll equal to your Charisma modifier. Regardless of whether the Strike hits, you and your allies gain a +1 status bonus to damage on subsequent Strikes made against the enemy until the start of your next turn. Increase the damage by 1 at 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.ey2zSEnprAGgvrij]{Effect: Get 'Em!}

feat->Guns Blazing.name: Guns Blazing
feat->Guns Blazing.description:
You lead your team by making an impression with firepower. Your bombastic personality has a barrage of gunfire to back it up, and you always shoot first.

Leadership Skill Acrobatics

Leadership Perk You gain @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.2kwXTUjYYhoAGySr]{Incredible Initiative} as a bonus feat.

Leadership Directive @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.RNilk6Evoi0xNbWX]{Ready Arms!}

action->Ready Arms!.name: Ready Arms!
action->Ready Arms!.description:
With quick commands, you get your allies to ready their equipment. You and all allies within 30 feet can Interact to draw, Switch Hands, or swap weapons as a reaction.

Lead by Example If you used two actions, you can Strike, Area Fire, or Auto-Fire with a weapon you drew or swapped to (including by changing active set of hands). If your Strike hits or if a target failed its save against your Area Fire or Auto-Fire, one ally can make a Strike against the same target as a reaction.

feat->Incredible Initiative.name: Incredible Initiative
feat->Incredible Initiative.description: You react more quickly than others can. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to initiative rolls.

action->Improvised Mastery.name: Improvised Mastery
action->Improvised Mastery.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You're about to attempt a skill check using a skill that you don't have master proficiency in, and you haven't rolled yet.

You trust your instincts to see you through. You gain master proficiency with the triggering skill for the skill check.

feat->Adaptive Talent.name: Adaptive Talent
feat->Adaptive Talent.description:
You're quick thinking and adaptable, capable of picking up new skills and talents with little practice or training. During your daily preparations, select one skill feat that you meet the prerequisites for. You gain this skill feat until you prepare again. Since you have this feat temporarily, you can't use it as a prerequisite for a permanent character option. You can use this for effects that temporarily give you access to other abilities, such as taking @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.P9HCz0uR6xPHuw72]{Multilingual} to temporarily learn a new language.

As your envoy level increases, so does your ability to adapt to new situations. At 9th level and 15th level, increase the number of skill feats you gain this way by 1. You can use feats that you temporarily gain through adaptive talent as a prerequisite for other feats that you temporarily gain through adaptive talent, but you still can't use them as prerequisites for permanent character options.

feat->Wise to the Game.name: Wise to the Game
feat->Wise to the Game.description: Using your words to influence others is what you do, and you easily recognize when others attempt to use the same tactics against you. You gain a +1 status bonus to your Perception DC against attempts to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie} to you and attempts to divert your attention with @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion}, and a +1 status bonus to your Will DC against emotion effects.

feat->Perception Expertise.name: Perception Expertise
feat->Perception Expertise.description:
Envoy You have a keen eye for details and always manage to remain alert to threats around you. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

Mystic, Soldier You remain alert to threats around you. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

Witchwarper You remain alert to threats. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

feat->Weapon Expertise.name: Weapon Expertise
feat->Weapon Expertise.description:
Envoy You've learned a few tricks with your weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks increase to expert. Whenever you attack the target of your Get 'Em!, you gain access to the critical specialization effects of all weapons for which you have expert proficiency.

Mystic You win battles with basic weapons. Your proficiency rank for simple weapons and unarmed attacks increases to expert.

Witchwarper You've gained a broader understanding of conventional weaponry to augment your unconventional spellcasting. Your proficiency rank for simple weapons and unarmed attacks increases to expert.

treasure->Credstick.name: Credstick
treasure->Credstick.description:
Most people in Starfinder keep their wealth on a protected item known as a credstick. These devices are often flat and roughly the size of a human finger. They range in dimensions and quality, but at the end of the day, they're just a means of conveniently carrying and spending money. Usage of these devices is determined by the owner, and a credstick can accept or spend funds with as simple an action as tapping it near a suitable banking device. When more rigorous security is necessary, they can require audio or biometric imprints in order to activate. Some advanced credsticks even have a magical component that might require a mental password or the recitation of a specific spell to access stored funds.

Credsticks aren't gateways to the entirety of one's wealth, and larger stores of credits are often kept secured in banks, personal vaults, or secure databases. Instead, a credstick is a safe and anonymous means of moving credits around without being traced. Adventurers and common citizens alike often keep a credstick on their person to handle any purchases they might be called upon to make, while also only keeping just enough credits on them that losing the credstick wouldn't result in bankruptcy.

Individuals in the Pact Worlds often carry credsticks, and other civilizations that interact with the Pact often turn local funds into credits and thus carry them to spend their converted currency. Sometimes a person might carry several credsticks, dedicating each one to a different use, or simply trading the stick away if they want to make a purchase of a predefined amount. If ever the number of credsticks on a person becomes too cumbersome, it's easy enough to move the funds between individual sticks and discard emptied sticks to save on space, however a credstick always has a negligible bulk.

ancestry->Human.name: Human
ancestry->Human.description:
As unpredictable and varied as any of Golarion's peoples, humans have exceptional drive and the capacity to endure and expand. Though many civilizations thrived before humanity rose to prominence, humans have built some of the greatest and the most terrible societies throughout the course of history, and today they are the most populous people in the realms around the Inner Sea.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.journals.JournalEntry.45SK8rdbbxvEHfMn.JournalEntryPage.7pU8yM7yPMw92SY3]{Human}

heritage->Skilled Human (Diplomacy).name: Skilled Human (Diplomacy)
heritage->Skilled Human (Diplomacy).description: Your ingenuity allows you to train in a wide variety of skills. You become trained in one skill of your choice. At 5th level, you become an expert in the chosen skill.

background->Outlaw.name: Outlaw
background->Outlaw.description:
You're a career criminal with a nasty reputation. Perhaps unfair circumstances forced you into a life of crime, or maybe you enjoy the thrill you get from pulling off a heist or living through a shoot-out. Either way, this life is the only one you know, and thanks to the bounty on your head, you're in it until the casket drops or you make enough creds to buy a new one.

Choose two attribute boosts. One must be to Strength or Charisma, and one is a free attribute boost.

You're trained in the Intimidation skill and the Underworld Lore skill. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.zdycsO9Z0wHBZ17k]{Intimidating Shot} skill feat.

feat->Intimidating Shot.name: Intimidating Shot
feat->Intimidating Shot.description: You attempt to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a foe with your ranged weapon by firing it into the air, using ammo equal to the weapon's expend and the weapon's maximum range rather than the usual range of 30 feet. This check doesn't take a –4 circumstance penalty if the target doesn't share a language with you.

class->Envoy.name: Envoy
class->Envoy.description: You're a master influencer. You make your way in the universe with a charming smile, quick wit, and keen sense of self-preservation. You're a leader who motivates your teammates, pushes them past their limits, and helps them through tough spots. You excel at getting others to do what you want, but you're always ready to face trouble head-on when things take a turn for the worse. You might be a con artist, diplomat, performer, or military officer—or you might take on whatever role the situation demands.

equipment->Comm Unit.name: Comm Unit
equipment->Comm Unit.description:
A personal comm unit is a pocket-sized device that combines a minor portable computer and a cellular communications device, allowing instantaneous wireless communication with other comm units in both audio- and text-based formats at planetary range. A personal comm unit also includes a calculator, a flashlight (emits bright light in a 5-foot radius around you and dim light in the next 5 feet), a browser that accesses any local infospheres, and several entertainment options (including games).

Personal comm units integrated into armor have some voice-activated capabilities; you can communicate with other comm units in audio-based formats and receive responses without needing a free hand, but typing a message, browsing the infosphere, or using an app requires the use of at least one hand.

Comm units that function at longer ranges aren't as portable; they include built-in generators that provide the necessary amount of power and rely on active Drift beacons to communicate. Short-term use of these units can be purchased in most major settlements.

weapon->Knife.name: Knife
weapon->Knife.description:
Upgrades: 1

Invaluable as both a weapon and a tool, knives come in a variety of shapes, styles, and materials ranging from starmetals to ceramics.

equipment->Medkit (Commercial).name: Medkit (Commercial)
equipment->Medkit (Commercial).description: These contain analgesics, bandages, sterile gauze, and suturing tools necessary for Medicine checks to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid}, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.TC7OcDa7JlWbqMaN]{Treat Disease}, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.KjoCEEmPGTeFE4hh]{Treat Poison}, or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds}.

weapon->Semi-Auto Pistol.name: Semi-Auto Pistol
weapon->Semi-Auto Pistol.description:
Upgrades: 1

This pistol automatically ejects used cartridges and loads new ammunition after every shot fired.

equipment->Infiltrator's Toolkit (Commer.name: Infiltrator's Toolkit (Commercial)
equipment->Infiltrator's Toolkit (Commer.description: You need an infiltrator's toolkit to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick Locks} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Devices} (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

feat->Size Up.name: Size Up
feat->Size Up.description:
Frequency once per hour

You spend 1 minute observing a specific individual, 10 minutes researching a specific individual on the infosphere, or 1 hour networking and gathering information. This subject is your asset. If you assess your asset via observation, you don't need to know their identity, but if you assess your asset via research or networking, you must know their identity, which requires at least two relevant pieces of information about them. Examples of relevant information could include their name, their place of origin, their current residence, the name of their parent or significant other, their employer, or their organizational affiliation. The GM determines what constitutes relevant information for this purpose, based on the asset you've selected.

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Perception checks against or in relation to your asset, and a +1 circumstance bonus to attempts to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about your asset.

You gain the benefits of the 2-action @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.cmCtfURzpbzkxWsy]{Get 'Em!} when using 1-action Get 'Em! on an asset.

You can maintain a number of assets equal to your Charisma modifier. If you Size Up other assets after that, your new asset replaces a previous one.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.RBWwGxsrxPBKi3X7]{Effect: Size Up}

feat->Natural Ambition.name: Natural Ambition
feat->Natural Ambition.description: You were raised to be ambitious and always reach for the stars, leading you to progress quickly in your chosen field. You gain a 1st-level class feat for your class. You must meet the prerequisites, but you can select the feat later in the character creation process in order to determine which prerequisites you meet.

feat->Watch Out.name: Watch Out
feat->Watch Out.description:
Trigger A creature targets an ally within 60 feet with an attack, and you can see both the attacker and your ally.

You signal a warning to your ally, granting them a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.8eqdNadBEcXMvjng]{Effect: Watch Out}

armor->Carbon Skin.name: Carbon Skin
armor->Carbon Skin.description:
Upgrades: 1

This form-fitting suit of carbon fiber encases the body. Most are usually dull-gray, functional garments, while pricier, bespoke suits dazzle like diamonds.

weapon->Laser Pistol.name: Laser Pistol
weapon->Laser Pistol.description:
Upgrades: 1

This compact pistol is the most popular sidearm in the Pact Worlds thanks to its reliability, durability, and affordability. Most common laser pistols have a lightweight polycarbon body ending in a long, slim barrel.

feat->Get in There!.name: Get in There!
feat->Get in There!.description:
You urge your allies to hustle into the fight or to get out of the way. Until the beginning of your next turn, you and your allies within 100 feet who can sense you gain a +5-foot status bonus to Speed. As your envoy level increases, increase the bonus by an additional 5 feet at 7th level, 12th level, and 17th level.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.dAcHJiPDtqxxrR4Z]{Effect: Get in There!}

Lead by Example If you used two actions, Step or Stride. Each of your allies within 100 feet who can sense you can immediately Step or Stride up to half their Speed (rounded down to the nearest 5 feet) as a reaction.

feat->Battle Medicine.name: Battle Medicine
feat->Battle Medicine.description:
Requirements You're holding or wearing a healer's toolkit.

You can patch up wounds, even in combat. Attempt a Medicine check with the same DC as for @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds} and restore the corresponding amount of HP; this doesn't remove the wounded condition. As with Treat Wounds, you can attempt checks against higher DCs if you have the minimum proficiency rank. The target is then @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.2XEYQNZTCGpdkyR6]{immune} to your Battle Medicine for 1 day. This does not make them immune to, or otherwise count as, Treat Wounds.

feat->Fleet.name: Fleet
feat->Fleet.description: You move more quickly on foot. Your Speed increases by 5 feet.

consumable->Medpatch (Tactical).name: Medpatch (Tactical)
consumable->Medpatch (Tactical).description:
Activate 1 (manipulate)

Medpatches accelerate the body's natural healing. You regain @Damage[(3d6+6)[healing]] Hit Points and gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment-effects.Item.VKSOvJQMwUby4fba]{Effect: Medpatch}

feat->Confident Actualization.name: Confident Actualization
feat->Confident Actualization.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You're about to attempt a saving throw or skill check.

Your utter confidence in your own abilities helps you push yourself to reach your desired goals. Roll the triggering check or save twice and use the better result.

feat->Diverse Schemes.name: Diverse Schemes
feat->Diverse Schemes.description: You're an efficient multitasker, and you always have more than one goal in mind or scheme on the go. You can maintain twice your Charisma modifier of assets.

feat->Kiss it Better.name: Kiss it Better
feat->Kiss it Better.description:
Requirements You have a hand free and are adjacent to an ally who isn't at full Hit Points.

You perform a token medical effort to convince an ally they've recovered from an injury. Attempt a Deception check with the same DC as for @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds}. On a success, the target gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the corresponding amount of Hit Points from Treat Wounds. These temporary Hit Points last 1 round. Kiss It Better doesn't remove the wounded condition. The target is temporarily immune to Kiss It Better for 24 hours.

equipment->Holoskin (Commercial).name: Holoskin (Commercial)
equipment->Holoskin (Commercial).description: A holographic projector mounted to a belt or limb strap can be activated as an Interact action. It can be programmed to project the appearance of another creature of the same size category as yourself, hiding your true appearance. A holoskin doesn't change your voice, scent, or mannerisms. The appearance of held and worn items aren't affected. You usually need a holoskin to set up a disguise in order to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate} someone using the Deception skill.

consumable->Invisibility Spell Amp.name: Invisibility Spell Amp
consumable->Invisibility Spell Amp.description:
Known on most worlds as "spell amps," spell ampoules are ready-to-use magic injections that confer the benefits of a spell of the specified rank.

Activate—Inject 1 (manipulate)

Effect 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility} spell

backpack->Null Space Chamber (Commercial.name: Null Space Chamber (Commercial)
backpack->Null Space Chamber (Commercial.description:
This sleek black device attaches to a backpack, purse, or key ring. When you press a button on the side of the device, it creates a circular portal to an extradimensional pocket space. The space's capacity depends on the device's type.

You can Interact with the null space chamber to stow items in it or remove them. The null space chamber can be opened and closed only from the outside. When a null space chamber is opened in an atmosphere with air, it fills with 10 minutes' worth of air for every Bulk left in its capacity. An item inside the null space chamber provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. Connecting the null space chamber to a computer causes it to display a readout of all items stored within it.

Capacity 25 Bulk

equipment->Hacking Toolkit (Tactical).name: Hacking Toolkit (Tactical)
equipment->Hacking Toolkit (Tactical).description: A hacking toolkit is required for Computers checks to Hack computers. You can use a hacking toolkit to access a computer without using a user interface, but this requires physical contact with the computer or contact via an infosphere or a similar linked network. A tactical hacking toolkit adds a +1 item bonus to checks made with it.

feat->Hang in There.name: Hang in There
feat->Hang in There.description:
You encourage yourself or an ally, psyching them up for a coming challenge and granting them temporary Hit Points. Choose yourself or an ally within 30 feet, then attempt a @Check[diplomacy|dc:20|showDC:all] check. If you have master proficiency in Diplomacy, you can instead attempt a @Check[diplomacy|dc:30|showDC:all] check to increase the temporary Hit Points gained on a successful check by 5. If you have legendary proficiency, you can instead attempt a @Check[diplomacy|dc:40|showDC:all] check to increase the temporary Hit Points gained on a successful check by 10. These temporary Hit Points last for 1 minute. The target is then temporarily immune to your Hang in There for 1 day.

Critical Success The target gains temporary Hit Points equal to double their level plus your Charisma modifier.

Success The target gains temporary Hit Points equal to their level plus your Charisma modifier.

Failure The target is unaffected, and you can't use Hang in There again for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is unaffected, and you can't use Hang in There again for 1 hour.

feat->Take the Wheel.name: Take the Wheel
feat->Take the Wheel.description: You Board and Take Control of an adjacent vehicle.

feat->Power Slide.name: Power Slide
feat->Power Slide.description: You throw the vehicle into a barely controlled skid, turning sharply to evade pursuit. You Drive with a –2 penalty to your Piloting check, gaining the effects of the Drive action for the same number of actions you spent to Power Slide. At the end of the movement, if you succeed, you can turn the vehicle up to 90 degrees. If you critically succeed at your Piloting check, you can instead turn the vehicle up to 180 degrees.

feat->Quick Disguise.name: Quick Disguise
feat->Quick Disguise.description: You can set up a disguise in one-tenth the usual time (generally 1 minute). If you're a master in Deception, you can create a full disguise and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate} as a 3-action activity. If you're legendary, it takes a single action.

feat->Envoy Directives.name: Envoy Directives
feat->Envoy Directives.description:
Envoys encourage their allies with directives. A directive is an order that benefits allies who follow it. Envoy directives include a way for the envoy to lead by example by spending more actions for increased effects. Directives have the auditory or visual trait depending on how you inspire your allies.

You begin with one envoy directive. You can learn more directives through the envoy class, envoy class feats, and your leadership style. You can issue one directive a round. Unless otherwise stated, an envoy's directive and the benefits it grants last until the beginning of your next turn.

You gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.cmCtfURzpbzkxWsy]{Get 'Em!} envoy directive.

feat->Leadership Style.name: Leadership Style
feat->Leadership Style.description:
Whether it comes naturally, or you trained for it, you've developed a personal style of leading others. At 1st level, select a leadership style. You become trained in the indicated leadership skill, you gain the indicated leadership perk, and know the associated leadership directive.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.u2dy5FMDv30UH8HC]{From the Front}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.KEoTccJlfKzMk19l]{From the Shadows}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.jaGIV3t7G07F0qda]{Guns Blazing}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.RIUhD5eldHzBsFIe]{In the Spotlight}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.GTmdHGLcuc11Bizi]{Infosphere Director}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.6cFaxZ4aAhuUbnwi]{Through Desperate Times}

feat->Improvised Mastery.name: Improvised Mastery
feat->Improvised Mastery.description: Whether by luck or instinct, you display impressive talent on the fly. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.WFFYDg0sgjaXCeq6]{Improvised Mastery} action.

feat->Leader's Confidence.name: Leader's Confidence
feat->Leader's Confidence.description: Whether you're calm and collected or projecting confidence through gritted teeth, you don't let your team see you lose your cool. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.gZr207z8Q7AuH2RT]{Steel Yourselves!} envoy directive.

action->Get 'Em!.name: Get 'Em!
action->Get 'Em!.description:
You single out an enemy for you and your allies to focus your attacks on. Select an enemy within 60 feet that you can see. You and your allies gain a +1 status bonus to attacks against that target until the beginning of your next turn.

Lead by Example If you used two actions, Strike the target. You gain a status bonus to the damage roll equal to your Charisma modifier. Regardless of whether the Strike hits, you and your allies gain a +1 status bonus to damage on subsequent Strikes made against the enemy until the start of your next turn. Increase the damage by 1 at 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.ey2zSEnprAGgvrij]{Effect: Get 'Em!}

feat->Guns Blazing.name: Guns Blazing
feat->Guns Blazing.description:
You lead your team by making an impression with firepower. Your bombastic personality has a barrage of gunfire to back it up, and you always shoot first.

Leadership Skill Acrobatics

Leadership Perk You gain @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.2kwXTUjYYhoAGySr]{Incredible Initiative} as a bonus feat.

Leadership Directive @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.RNilk6Evoi0xNbWX]{Ready Arms!}

action->Ready Arms!.name: Ready Arms!
action->Ready Arms!.description:
With quick commands, you get your allies to ready their equipment. You and all allies within 30 feet can Interact to draw, Switch Hands, or swap weapons as a reaction.

Lead by Example If you used two actions, you can Strike, Area Fire, or Auto-Fire with a weapon you drew or swapped to (including by changing active set of hands). If your Strike hits or if a target failed its save against your Area Fire or Auto-Fire, one ally can make a Strike against the same target as a reaction.

feat->Incredible Initiative.name: Incredible Initiative
feat->Incredible Initiative.description: You react more quickly than others can. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to initiative rolls.

action->Improvised Mastery.name: Improvised Mastery
action->Improvised Mastery.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You're about to attempt a skill check using a skill that you don't have master proficiency in, and you haven't rolled yet.

You trust your instincts to see you through. You gain master proficiency with the triggering skill for the skill check.

action->Steel Yourselves!.name: Steel Yourselves!
action->Steel Yourselves!.description:
Frequency once per hour

You encourage your allies to brace for impact or otherwise prepare for incoming damage. Allies within 60 feet who can sense you can spend 1 action on their turn to Brace For Impact. This action has the concentrate trait. Creatures that Brace for Impact gain temporary Hit Points equal to your Charisma modifier + your half your level for 1 minute.

Lead by Example If you spends two actions, you Brace For Impact. You and any ally who Braces for Impact before the start of your next turn also gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws against effects that deal damage for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.RhmWzzEbiykniDHQ]{Effect: Steel Yourselves!}

feat->Adaptive Talent.name: Adaptive Talent
feat->Adaptive Talent.description:
You're quick thinking and adaptable, capable of picking up new skills and talents with little practice or training. During your daily preparations, select one skill feat that you meet the prerequisites for. You gain this skill feat until you prepare again. Since you have this feat temporarily, you can't use it as a prerequisite for a permanent character option. You can use this for effects that temporarily give you access to other abilities, such as taking @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.P9HCz0uR6xPHuw72]{Multilingual} to temporarily learn a new language.

As your envoy level increases, so does your ability to adapt to new situations. At 9th level and 15th level, increase the number of skill feats you gain this way by 1. You can use feats that you temporarily gain through adaptive talent as a prerequisite for other feats that you temporarily gain through adaptive talent, but you still can't use them as prerequisites for permanent character options.

feat->Perception Expertise.name: Perception Expertise
feat->Perception Expertise.description:
Envoy You have a keen eye for details and always manage to remain alert to threats around you. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

Mystic, Soldier You remain alert to threats around you. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

Witchwarper You remain alert to threats. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

feat->Wise to the Game.name: Wise to the Game
feat->Wise to the Game.description: Using your words to influence others is what you do, and you easily recognize when others attempt to use the same tactics against you. You gain a +1 status bonus to your Perception DC against attempts to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie} to you and attempts to divert your attention with @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion}, and a +1 status bonus to your Will DC against emotion effects.

feat->Weapon Expertise.name: Weapon Expertise
feat->Weapon Expertise.description:
Envoy You've learned a few tricks with your weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks increase to expert. Whenever you attack the target of your Get 'Em!, you gain access to the critical specialization effects of all weapons for which you have expert proficiency.

Mystic You win battles with basic weapons. Your proficiency rank for simple weapons and unarmed attacks increases to expert.

Witchwarper You've gained a broader understanding of conventional weaponry to augment your unconventional spellcasting. Your proficiency rank for simple weapons and unarmed attacks increases to expert.

feat->Fortitude Expertise.name: Fortitude Expertise
feat->Fortitude Expertise.description:
Envoy Your physique is incredibly hardy. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert.

Mystic Your physique has grown hardier from your adventures. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert.

feat->Weapon Specialization.name: Weapon Specialization
feat->Weapon Specialization.description:
Envoy, Operative, Witchwarper You've learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert. This damage increases to 3 damage if you're a master, and 4 damage if you're legendary.

Mystic You've learned to protect yourself and your allies with your weapons. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master and 4 if you're legendary.

Solarian You've learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you've practiced with most. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master, and 4 if you're legendary.

Soldier You inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master, and 4 if you're legendary.

treasure->Credstick.name: Credstick
treasure->Credstick.description:
Most people in Starfinder keep their wealth on a protected item known as a credstick. These devices are often flat and roughly the size of a human finger. They range in dimensions and quality, but at the end of the day, they're just a means of conveniently carrying and spending money. Usage of these devices is determined by the owner, and a credstick can accept or spend funds with as simple an action as tapping it near a suitable banking device. When more rigorous security is necessary, they can require audio or biometric imprints in order to activate. Some advanced credsticks even have a magical component that might require a mental password or the recitation of a specific spell to access stored funds.

Credsticks aren't gateways to the entirety of one's wealth, and larger stores of credits are often kept secured in banks, personal vaults, or secure databases. Instead, a credstick is a safe and anonymous means of moving credits around without being traced. Adventurers and common citizens alike often keep a credstick on their person to handle any purchases they might be called upon to make, while also only keeping just enough credits on them that losing the credstick wouldn't result in bankruptcy.

Individuals in the Pact Worlds often carry credsticks, and other civilizations that interact with the Pact often turn local funds into credits and thus carry them to spend their converted currency. Sometimes a person might carry several credsticks, dedicating each one to a different use, or simply trading the stick away if they want to make a purchase of a predefined amount. If ever the number of credsticks on a person becomes too cumbersome, it's easy enough to move the funds between individual sticks and discard emptied sticks to save on space, however a credstick always has a negligible bulk.

heritage->Briskwander Vesk.name: Briskwander Vesk
heritage->Briskwander Vesk.description: You come from a line of vesk who were constantly on the move. Your Speed increases by 5 feet.

background->Trooper.name: Trooper
background->Trooper.description:
You enlisted in a military or were recruited by a paramilitary group as a career trooper. As long as you've got enough guns and the right squad to back you up, you can handle just about anything.

Choose two attribute boosts. One must be to Strength or Constitution, and one is a free attribute boost.

You're trained in the Athletics skill and the Warfare Lore skill. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.9S5mBcJujWOYCE6j]{Barricade} feat.

feat->Barricade.name: Barricade
feat->Barricade.description: You hastily create a barricade using nearby items, junk, or debris. The barricade provides lesser cover for you and one other ally, though you can @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} to increase this benefit to standard cover. The barricade is flimsy and falls apart at the end of your next turn.

class->Soldier.name: Soldier
class->Soldier.description: You're a master of area weapons, heavy armor, and soaking damage. You fight in the thick of the battle and unleash devastating salvos against your foes as you take withering fire in return. By laying down a barrage of suppressing fire with powerful weapons, you set your allies up to fulfill their respective roles while encouraging enemies to focus on you.

feat->Fearless.name: Fearless
feat->Fearless.description: Whether it comes from a sense of duty or a desire to succeed, you rarely flinch when confronted by fearsome foes. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a fear effect, you get a critical success instead.

feat->Quick Swap.name: Quick Swap
feat->Quick Swap.description:
Trigger You're wielding a two-handed weapon, and an enemy creature moves adjacent to you.

You can switch weapons in stressful situations so that you quickly set yourself up to punish incoming foes. You stow your current weapon and draw another two-handed weapon. If you have multiple sets of arms, you can instead Switch Hands.

equipment->Comm Unit.name: Comm Unit
equipment->Comm Unit.description:
A personal comm unit is a pocket-sized device that combines a minor portable computer and a cellular communications device, allowing instantaneous wireless communication with other comm units in both audio- and text-based formats at planetary range. A personal comm unit also includes a calculator, a flashlight (emits bright light in a 5-foot radius around you and dim light in the next 5 feet), a browser that accesses any local infospheres, and several entertainment options (including games).

Personal comm units integrated into armor have some voice-activated capabilities; you can communicate with other comm units in audio-based formats and receive responses without needing a free hand, but typing a message, browsing the infosphere, or using an app requires the use of at least one hand.

Comm units that function at longer ranges aren't as portable; they include built-in generators that provide the necessary amount of power and rely on active Drift beacons to communicate. Short-term use of these units can be purchased in most major settlements.

weapon->Doshko.name: Doshko
weapon->Doshko.description:
Upgrades: 1

The traditional weapon of the Veskarium, this powered poleaxe features one to three triangular blades forged for both wide overhead swings and tactical parrying.

weapon->Machine Gun.name: Machine Gun
weapon->Machine Gun.description:
Upgrades: 1

These proven and reliable automatic weapons are capable of firing in short bursts or completely emptying their magazines to clear a battlefield.

armor->Shotalashu Armor.name: Shotalashu Armor
armor->Shotalashu Armor.description:
Upgrades: 1

Flexible but sturdy plates layered together form this traditional armor worn by lashunta cavalry on Castrovel. In times past, a shotalashu cavalry member forged their armor from their mount's shed skin, or more rarely, the skin of a fallen mount, to honor them in future battles. Synthetic imitations are fashionable on some parts of Castrovel.

feat->Soldier Fighting Style.name: Soldier Fighting Style
feat->Soldier Fighting Style.description:
As a soldier, you train using a specific style of fighting. Your style determines how you approach combat and often changes how you take advantage of your ability to suppress targets. Choose a soldier fighting style.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.ajzZpzc8uMtgU6N8]{Action Hero}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.T78VQC8oaD1Odz1k]{Armor Storm}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.VDEYb7aAwAjBp8Av]{Bombard}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.5mOTKBsn8OsEvFaA]{Close Quarters}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.FSAqTE67445EvyX8]{Erudite Warrior}

feat->Bombard.name: Bombard
feat->Bombard.description:
There's nothing like a big gun (or maybe several) to get you through tough times. You've come to terms with the fact that a stray bullet from one of your barrages might sometimes hit an ally, but you try to minimize such instances of "friendly fire." You've trained to avoid harming allies with your barrages and learned to expertly position your attacks around them.

When you attack with an area weapon, you can select a number of allies within the area equal to half your Constitution modifier. The selected allies are unaffected by the attack. In addition, enemies who succeed (but not critically succeed) on their save against an area attack you make are still @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until the start of your next turn.

feat->Primary Target.name: Primary Target
feat->Primary Target.description: You can focus fire on a single target when unleashing the full devastation of your powerful area weaponry. Before you make an area attack with a weapon (such as from the Area Fire or Auto-Fire actions), you can make a ranged Strike as a free action with the same weapon against a single creature in the area, who's selected as your primary target. If your attack is a burst, you must select the creature closest to the center of the attack. If your attack is a cone or line, you must select the creature closest to you. If two or more creatures are equidistant, you can choose which one is your primary target. On a hit, if your primary target rolls a success against your Area Fire or Auto-Fire action, they get a failure instead. This Strike doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty.

feat->Suppressing Fire.name: Suppressing Fire
feat->Suppressing Fire.description: You have a knack for using powerful weapons to harry your foes and hinder their movement, preventing them from operating at their peak. If you make an attack with a weapon that has the area trait (such as from the Area Fire or Auto-Fire actions), you use it in a manner that suppresses your targets. Enemies in the affected area who fail their save against your attack become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until the start of your next turn. A suppressed target takes a –1 circumstance penalty on attack rolls and takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds. Some soldier abilities and class feats interact further with the suppressed condition.

feat->Walking Armory.name: Walking Armory
feat->Walking Armory.description:
Your endurance training empowers you to carry a load of heavy equipment. When determining your Strength for using armor, you can instead choose to use your Constitution modifier. If you already meet the Strength requirement for the armor you're wearing, reduce that armor's Bulk by 1 (to a minimum of 1).

In addition, increase the amount of Bulk you can carry before becoming encumbered by half your Constitution modifier rounded up. Increase your maximum carried Bulk by your Constitution modifier.

weapon->Machine Gun.name: Machine Gun
weapon->Machine Gun.description:
Upgrades: 1

These proven and reliable automatic weapons are capable of firing in short bursts or completely emptying their magazines to clear a battlefield.

feat->Menacing Laughter.name: Menacing Laughter
feat->Menacing Laughter.description: Your laughter (or other vocalization) remains audible over the din of your weapons fire. Attempt an Intimidation check to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} each creature within 30 feet who's @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed}.

feat->Deadlift.name: Deadlift
feat->Deadlift.description:
Requirements You aren't @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

For 1 minute, you can carry 4 more Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered. The amount you can carry increases to 6 at expert, 8 at master, and 10 at legendary. When the benefits of this feat end, you become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for 10 minutes.

feat->Toughness.name: Toughness
feat->Toughness.description: Your body can withstand more punishment than most before succumbing. Increase your maximum Hit Points by your level. You reduce the DC of recovery checks by 1.

armor->Hidden Soldier Armor.name: Hidden Soldier Armor
armor->Hidden Soldier Armor.description:
Upgrades: 1

This suit of heavy armor features a slitted helmet that reveals only the wearer's eyes. This high-tech ceramic suit consists of breastplate, shoulder guards, bracers, and greaves that flex with the body's movements.

feat->Soldier Fighting Style.name: Soldier Fighting Style
feat->Soldier Fighting Style.description:
As a soldier, you train using a specific style of fighting. Your style determines how you approach combat and often changes how you take advantage of your ability to suppress targets. Choose a soldier fighting style.

feat->Fearsome Bulwark.name: Fearsome Bulwark
feat->Fearsome Bulwark.description: Your sheer bulk terrifies foes, clearing a path for you on the battlefield. You can use your Constitution modifier instead of your Charisma modifier on Intimidation checks to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} and instead of your Strength modifier on Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.lOE4yjUnETTdaf2T]{Reposition} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}.

feat->Reflex Expertise.name: Reflex Expertise
feat->Reflex Expertise.description:
Mystic Your connection blesses you with insight that helps you dodge danger. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to expert.

Soldier You've developed a knack for dodging danger. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to expert.

Witchwarper Your awareness of possible dangers, through incredible analysis or an understanding of the wider multiverse, increases your reflexes. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to expert.

feat->Terrifying Bravado.name: Terrifying Bravado
feat->Terrifying Bravado.description:
Trigger You critically succeed on a save against a fear effect whose source was a creature, or a creature fails or critically fails an Intimidation check to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} you.

You laugh at your enemy's failed attempts to bully you, turning the tables on your foe with a display of terrifying bravado. You attempt an Intimidation check to Demoralize the triggering creature.

feat->Powerful Leap.name: Powerful Leap
feat->Powerful Leap.description: You can jump 5 feet up with a vertical @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} without making a @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump}. You also increase the horizontal distance when you Leap, including as part of a High Jump or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}, by 5 feet.

weapon->Frag Grenade (Commercial).name: Frag Grenade (Commercial)
weapon->Frag Grenade (Commercial).description:
Activate 1 Area Fire

Critical @Damage[1[bleed]]

These fragmentary grenades explode in a cloud of shrapnel and deal 1d8 piercing damage in a @Template[burst|distance:5] with a @Check[reflex|against:class|basic] save.

weapon->Grenade Launcher (Commercial).name: Grenade Launcher (Commercial)
weapon->Grenade Launcher (Commercial).description:
Activate 2 Area Fire

The rotating barrel of this automatic breechloading launcher holds up to six grenades of any variety with smart loading technology, allowing its wielder to choose a different grenade each time they fire. A grenade launcher is a martial ranged weapon, has a reload of 2, and a range 280 feet.

weapon->Incendiary Grenade (Commercial).name: Incendiary Grenade (Commercial)
weapon->Incendiary Grenade (Commercial).description:
Activate 1 Area Fire

Critical 5 feet

These grenades use an ignited chemical to explode in a blast of intense heat and deal 1d8 fire damage with a @Check[reflex|against:class|basic] save (@Template[burst|distance:5]). If you have access to the critical specialization effect of grenades, creatures who critically fail their saving throw against incendiary grenades are knocked away from the grenade.

feat->Widen Area.name: Widen Area
feat->Widen Area.description:
Requirements You're wielding an area or automatic weapon.

You set up your area weapon to affect more targets. If the next action you use is to Area Fire or Auto-Fire in a burst, cone, or line, or if you use @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.xND8wnEdnGSq84kn]{Whirling Swipe}, you increase the area of that attack. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius isn't affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that's normally 15 feet or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

feat->Soldier Fighting Style.name: Soldier Fighting Style
feat->Soldier Fighting Style.description:
As a soldier, you train using a specific style of fighting. Your style determines how you approach combat and often changes how you take advantage of your ability to suppress targets. Choose a soldier fighting style.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.ajzZpzc8uMtgU6N8]{Action Hero}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.T78VQC8oaD1Odz1k]{Armor Storm}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.VDEYb7aAwAjBp8Av]{Bombard}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.5mOTKBsn8OsEvFaA]{Close Quarters}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.FSAqTE67445EvyX8]{Erudite Warrior}

feat->Bombard.name: Bombard
feat->Bombard.description:
There's nothing like a big gun (or maybe several) to get you through tough times. You've come to terms with the fact that a stray bullet from one of your barrages might sometimes hit an ally, but you try to minimize such instances of "friendly fire." You've trained to avoid harming allies with your barrages and learned to expertly position your attacks around them.

When you attack with an area weapon, you can select a number of allies within the area equal to half your Constitution modifier. The selected allies are unaffected by the attack. In addition, enemies who succeed (but not critically succeed) on their save against an area attack you make are still @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until the start of your next turn.

feat->Primary Target.name: Primary Target
feat->Primary Target.description: You can focus fire on a single target when unleashing the full devastation of your powerful area weaponry. Before you make an area attack with a weapon (such as from the Area Fire or Auto-Fire actions), you can make a ranged Strike as a free action with the same weapon against a single creature in the area, who's selected as your primary target. If your attack is a burst, you must select the creature closest to the center of the attack. If your attack is a cone or line, you must select the creature closest to you. If two or more creatures are equidistant, you can choose which one is your primary target. On a hit, if your primary target rolls a success against your Area Fire or Auto-Fire action, they get a failure instead. This Strike doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty.

feat->Suppressing Fire.name: Suppressing Fire
feat->Suppressing Fire.description: You have a knack for using powerful weapons to harry your foes and hinder their movement, preventing them from operating at their peak. If you make an attack with a weapon that has the area trait (such as from the Area Fire or Auto-Fire actions), you use it in a manner that suppresses your targets. Enemies in the affected area who fail their save against your attack become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until the start of your next turn. A suppressed target takes a –1 circumstance penalty on attack rolls and takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds. Some soldier abilities and class feats interact further with the suppressed condition.

feat->Walking Armory.name: Walking Armory
feat->Walking Armory.description:
Your endurance training empowers you to carry a load of heavy equipment. When determining your Strength for using armor, you can instead choose to use your Constitution modifier. If you already meet the Strength requirement for the armor you're wearing, reduce that armor's Bulk by 1 (to a minimum of 1).

In addition, increase the amount of Bulk you can carry before becoming encumbered by half your Constitution modifier rounded up. Increase your maximum carried Bulk by your Constitution modifier.

feat->Fearsome Bulwark.name: Fearsome Bulwark
feat->Fearsome Bulwark.description: Your sheer bulk terrifies foes, clearing a path for you on the battlefield. You can use your Constitution modifier instead of your Charisma modifier on Intimidation checks to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} and instead of your Strength modifier on Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.lOE4yjUnETTdaf2T]{Reposition} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}.

feat->Reflex Expertise.name: Reflex Expertise
feat->Reflex Expertise.description:
Mystic Your connection blesses you with insight that helps you dodge danger. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to expert.

Soldier You've developed a knack for dodging danger. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to expert.

Witchwarper Your awareness of possible dangers, through incredible analysis or an understanding of the wider multiverse, increases your reflexes. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to expert.

feat->Soldier Weapon Expert.name: Soldier Weapon Expert
feat->Soldier Weapon Expert.description: Through practical experience, you've learned how to use your weapons in a way that both pulverizes your foes and best takes advantage of your area attacks. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks increases to expert. You gain access to the critical specialization effects of weapons with the area or automatic traits.

feat->Perception Expertise.name: Perception Expertise
feat->Perception Expertise.description:
Envoy You have a keen eye for details and always manage to remain alert to threats around you. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

Mystic, Soldier You remain alert to threats around you. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

Witchwarper You remain alert to threats. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

treasure->Credstick.name: Credstick
treasure->Credstick.description:
Most people in Starfinder keep their wealth on a protected item known as a credstick. These devices are often flat and roughly the size of a human finger. They range in dimensions and quality, but at the end of the day, they're just a means of conveniently carrying and spending money. Usage of these devices is determined by the owner, and a credstick can accept or spend funds with as simple an action as tapping it near a suitable banking device. When more rigorous security is necessary, they can require audio or biometric imprints in order to activate. Some advanced credsticks even have a magical component that might require a mental password or the recitation of a specific spell to access stored funds.

Credsticks aren't gateways to the entirety of one's wealth, and larger stores of credits are often kept secured in banks, personal vaults, or secure databases. Instead, a credstick is a safe and anonymous means of moving credits around without being traced. Adventurers and common citizens alike often keep a credstick on their person to handle any purchases they might be called upon to make, while also only keeping just enough credits on them that losing the credstick wouldn't result in bankruptcy.

Individuals in the Pact Worlds often carry credsticks, and other civilizations that interact with the Pact often turn local funds into credits and thus carry them to spend their converted currency. Sometimes a person might carry several credsticks, dedicating each one to a different use, or simply trading the stick away if they want to make a purchase of a predefined amount. If ever the number of credsticks on a person becomes too cumbersome, it's easy enough to move the funds between individual sticks and discard emptied sticks to save on space, however a credstick always has a negligible bulk.

heritage->Briskwander Vesk.name: Briskwander Vesk
heritage->Briskwander Vesk.description: You come from a line of vesk who were constantly on the move. Your Speed increases by 5 feet.

background->Trooper.name: Trooper
background->Trooper.description:
You enlisted in a military or were recruited by a paramilitary group as a career trooper. As long as you've got enough guns and the right squad to back you up, you can handle just about anything.

Choose two attribute boosts. One must be to Strength or Constitution, and one is a free attribute boost.

You're trained in the Athletics skill and the Warfare Lore skill. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.9S5mBcJujWOYCE6j]{Barricade} feat.

feat->Barricade.name: Barricade
feat->Barricade.description: You hastily create a barricade using nearby items, junk, or debris. The barricade provides lesser cover for you and one other ally, though you can @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} to increase this benefit to standard cover. The barricade is flimsy and falls apart at the end of your next turn.

class->Soldier.name: Soldier
class->Soldier.description: You're a master of area weapons, heavy armor, and soaking damage. You fight in the thick of the battle and unleash devastating salvos against your foes as you take withering fire in return. By laying down a barrage of suppressing fire with powerful weapons, you set your allies up to fulfill their respective roles while encouraging enemies to focus on you.

feat->Fearless.name: Fearless
feat->Fearless.description: Whether it comes from a sense of duty or a desire to succeed, you rarely flinch when confronted by fearsome foes. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a fear effect, you get a critical success instead.

feat->Quick Swap.name: Quick Swap
feat->Quick Swap.description:
Trigger You're wielding a two-handed weapon, and an enemy creature moves adjacent to you.

You can switch weapons in stressful situations so that you quickly set yourself up to punish incoming foes. You stow your current weapon and draw another two-handed weapon. If you have multiple sets of arms, you can instead Switch Hands.

equipment->Comm Unit.name: Comm Unit
equipment->Comm Unit.description:
A personal comm unit is a pocket-sized device that combines a minor portable computer and a cellular communications device, allowing instantaneous wireless communication with other comm units in both audio- and text-based formats at planetary range. A personal comm unit also includes a calculator, a flashlight (emits bright light in a 5-foot radius around you and dim light in the next 5 feet), a browser that accesses any local infospheres, and several entertainment options (including games).

Personal comm units integrated into armor have some voice-activated capabilities; you can communicate with other comm units in audio-based formats and receive responses without needing a free hand, but typing a message, browsing the infosphere, or using an app requires the use of at least one hand.

Comm units that function at longer ranges aren't as portable; they include built-in generators that provide the necessary amount of power and rely on active Drift beacons to communicate. Short-term use of these units can be purchased in most major settlements.

weapon->Doshko.name: Doshko
weapon->Doshko.description:
Upgrades: 1

The traditional weapon of the Veskarium, this powered poleaxe features one to three triangular blades forged for both wide overhead swings and tactical parrying.

weapon->Machine Gun.name: Machine Gun
weapon->Machine Gun.description:
Upgrades: 1

These proven and reliable automatic weapons are capable of firing in short bursts or completely emptying their magazines to clear a battlefield.

feat->Menacing Laughter.name: Menacing Laughter
feat->Menacing Laughter.description: Your laughter (or other vocalization) remains audible over the din of your weapons fire. Attempt an Intimidation check to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} each creature within 30 feet who's @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed}.

feat->Deadlift.name: Deadlift
feat->Deadlift.description:
Requirements You aren't @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

For 1 minute, you can carry 4 more Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered. The amount you can carry increases to 6 at expert, 8 at master, and 10 at legendary. When the benefits of this feat end, you become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for 10 minutes.

feat->Toughness.name: Toughness
feat->Toughness.description: Your body can withstand more punishment than most before succumbing. Increase your maximum Hit Points by your level. You reduce the DC of recovery checks by 1.

armor->Hidden Soldier Armor.name: Hidden Soldier Armor
armor->Hidden Soldier Armor.description:
Upgrades: 1

This suit of heavy armor features a slitted helmet that reveals only the wearer's eyes. This high-tech ceramic suit consists of breastplate, shoulder guards, bracers, and greaves that flex with the body's movements.

feat->Terrifying Bravado.name: Terrifying Bravado
feat->Terrifying Bravado.description:
Trigger You critically succeed on a save against a fear effect whose source was a creature, or a creature fails or critically fails an Intimidation check to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} you.

You laugh at your enemy's failed attempts to bully you, turning the tables on your foe with a display of terrifying bravado. You attempt an Intimidation check to Demoralize the triggering creature.

feat->Intimidating Taunt.name: Intimidating Taunt
feat->Intimidating Taunt.description:
You taunt your enemy mercilessly, forcing them to acknowledge you as an immediate threat. Attempt an @Check[intimidation|against:will] check and compare it to the Will DC of one enemy creature within 60 feet. This action has the auditory trait or visual trait, depending on how you taunt your enemy.

Critical Success Your taunts sting hard. Until the start of your next turn, any hostile actions that the creature takes must include you as a target or include you in the area; otherwise, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls and to its save DC for those hostile actions.

Success As critical success, but only the first hostile action that the creature takes is affected.

Failure The creature is unaffected.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.B0ZDwyk4qOr7hp4e]{Effect: Intimidating Taunt}

feat->Powerful Leap.name: Powerful Leap
feat->Powerful Leap.description: You can jump 5 feet up with a vertical @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} without making a @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump}. You also increase the horizontal distance when you Leap, including as part of a High Jump or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}, by 5 feet.

weapon->Frag Grenade (Commercial).name: Frag Grenade (Commercial)
weapon->Frag Grenade (Commercial).description:
Activate 1 Area Fire

Critical @Damage[1[bleed]]

These fragmentary grenades explode in a cloud of shrapnel and deal 1d8 piercing damage in a @Template[burst|distance:5] with a @Check[reflex|against:class|basic] save.

weapon->Grenade Launcher (Commercial).name: Grenade Launcher (Commercial)
weapon->Grenade Launcher (Commercial).description:
Activate 2 Area Fire

The rotating barrel of this automatic breechloading launcher holds up to six grenades of any variety with smart loading technology, allowing its wielder to choose a different grenade each time they fire. A grenade launcher is a martial ranged weapon, has a reload of 2, and a range 280 feet.

weapon->Incendiary Grenade (Commercial).name: Incendiary Grenade (Commercial)
weapon->Incendiary Grenade (Commercial).description:
Activate 1 Area Fire

Critical 5 feet

These grenades use an ignited chemical to explode in a blast of intense heat and deal 1d8 fire damage with a @Check[reflex|against:class|basic] save (@Template[burst|distance:5]). If you have access to the critical specialization effect of grenades, creatures who critically fail their saving throw against incendiary grenades are knocked away from the grenade.

feat->Widen Area.name: Widen Area
feat->Widen Area.description:
Requirements You're wielding an area or automatic weapon.

You set up your area weapon to affect more targets. If the next action you use is to Area Fire or Auto-Fire in a burst, cone, or line, or if you use @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.xND8wnEdnGSq84kn]{Whirling Swipe}, you increase the area of that attack. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius isn't affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that's normally 15 feet or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

feat->Intimidating Prowess.name: Intimidating Prowess
feat->Intimidating Prowess.description: In situations where you can physically menace the target when you @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your Intimidation check and you ignore the penalty for not sharing a language. If your Strength modifier is +5 or higher and you are a master in Intimidation, this bonus increases to +2.

feat->Fleet.name: Fleet
feat->Fleet.description: You move more quickly on foot. Your Speed increases by 5 feet.

feat->Soldier Fighting Style.name: Soldier Fighting Style
feat->Soldier Fighting Style.description:
As a soldier, you train using a specific style of fighting. Your style determines how you approach combat and often changes how you take advantage of your ability to suppress targets. Choose a soldier fighting style.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.ajzZpzc8uMtgU6N8]{Action Hero}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.T78VQC8oaD1Odz1k]{Armor Storm}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.VDEYb7aAwAjBp8Av]{Bombard}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.5mOTKBsn8OsEvFaA]{Close Quarters}

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.FSAqTE67445EvyX8]{Erudite Warrior}

feat->Fearsome Bulwark.description: Your sheer bulk terrifies foes, clearing a path for you on the battlefield. You can use your Constitution modifier instead of your Charisma modifier on Intimidation checks to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} and instead of your Strength modifier on Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.lOE4yjUnETTdaf2T]{Reposition} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}.

feat->Reflex Expertise.name: Reflex Expertise
feat->Reflex Expertise.description:
Mystic Your connection blesses you with insight that helps you dodge danger. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to expert.

Soldier You've developed a knack for dodging danger. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to expert.

Witchwarper Your awareness of possible dangers, through incredible analysis or an understanding of the wider multiverse, increases your reflexes. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to expert.

feat->Soldier Weapon Expert.name: Soldier Weapon Expert
feat->Soldier Weapon Expert.description: Through practical experience, you've learned how to use your weapons in a way that both pulverizes your foes and best takes advantage of your area attacks. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks increases to expert. You gain access to the critical specialization effects of weapons with the area or automatic traits.

feat->Perception Expertise.name: Perception Expertise
feat->Perception Expertise.description:
Envoy You have a keen eye for details and always manage to remain alert to threats around you. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

Mystic, Soldier You remain alert to threats around you. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

Witchwarper You remain alert to threats. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

feat->Soldier Expertise.name: Soldier Expertise
feat->Soldier Expertise.description: Your ability to unleash area attacks and utilize your equipment improves. Your proficiency rank for your soldier class DC increases to expert.

feat->Tough as Nails.name: Tough as Nails
feat->Tough as Nails.description: Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.

feat->Armor Expertise.name: Armor Expertise
feat->Armor Expertise.description:
Mystic The bonds you've forged protect you like supernatural armor. Your proficiency rank in light armor and unarmored defense increases to expert.

Solarian You've spent so much time in armor that you know how to make the most of its protection. Your proficiency ranks for light armor, medium armor, and unarmored defense increase to expert.

Soldier You have grown accustomed to wearing armor and can make the most of its protection. Your proficiency ranks for light armor, medium armor, heavy armor, and unarmored defense increase to expert. You gain the armor specialization effects of medium and heavy armor.

feat->Weapon Specialization.name: Weapon Specialization
feat->Weapon Specialization.description:
Envoy, Operative, Witchwarper You've learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert. This damage increases to 3 damage if you're a master, and 4 damage if you're legendary.

Mystic You've learned to protect yourself and your allies with your weapons. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master and 4 if you're legendary.

Solarian You've learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you've practiced with most. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master, and 4 if you're legendary.

Soldier You inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master, and 4 if you're legendary.

treasure->Credstick.name: Credstick
treasure->Credstick.description:
Most people in Starfinder keep their wealth on a protected item known as a credstick. These devices are often flat and roughly the size of a human finger. They range in dimensions and quality, but at the end of the day, they're just a means of conveniently carrying and spending money. Usage of these devices is determined by the owner, and a credstick can accept or spend funds with as simple an action as tapping it near a suitable banking device. When more rigorous security is necessary, they can require audio or biometric imprints in order to activate. Some advanced credsticks even have a magical component that might require a mental password or the recitation of a specific spell to access stored funds.

Credsticks aren't gateways to the entirety of one's wealth, and larger stores of credits are often kept secured in banks, personal vaults, or secure databases. Instead, a credstick is a safe and anonymous means of moving credits around without being traced. Adventurers and common citizens alike often keep a credstick on their person to handle any purchases they might be called upon to make, while also only keeping just enough credits on them that losing the credstick wouldn't result in bankruptcy.

Individuals in the Pact Worlds often carry credsticks, and other civilizations that interact with the Pact often turn local funds into credits and thus carry them to spend their converted currency. Sometimes a person might carry several credsticks, dedicating each one to a different use, or simply trading the stick away if they want to make a purchase of a predefined amount. If ever the number of credsticks on a person becomes too cumbersome, it's easy enough to move the funds between individual sticks and discard emptied sticks to save on space, however a credstick always has a negligible bulk.

ancestry->Human.name: Human
ancestry->Human.description:
As unpredictable and varied as any of Golarion's peoples, humans have exceptional drive and the capacity to endure and expand. Though many civilizations thrived before humanity rose to prominence, humans have built some of the greatest and the most terrible societies throughout the course of history, and today they are the most populous people in the realms around the Inner Sea.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.journals.JournalEntry.45SK8rdbbxvEHfMn.JournalEntryPage.7pU8yM7yPMw92SY3]{Human}

ancestry->Human.name: Human
ancestry->Human.description:
As unpredictable and varied as any of Golarion's peoples, humans have exceptional drive and the capacity to endure and expand. Though many civilizations thrived before humanity rose to prominence, humans have built some of the greatest and the most terrible societies throughout the course of history, and today they are the most populous people in the realms around the Inner Sea.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.journals.JournalEntry.45SK8rdbbxvEHfMn.JournalEntryPage.7pU8yM7yPMw92SY3]{Human}

heritage->Versatile Human.name: Versatile Human
heritage->Versatile Human.description: Humanity's versatility and ambition have fueled its ascendance to be the most common ancestry in most nations throughout the world. Select a general feat of your choice for which you meet the prerequisites (as with your ancestry feat, you can select this general feat at any point during character creation).

feat->Feather Step.name: Feather Step
feat->Feather Step.description: You step carefully and quickly. You can Step into difficult terrain.

background->Grifter.name: Grifter
background->Grifter.description:
You're a con artist and trickster who swindles unsuspecting dupes and blackmails rubes, but it's nothing personal—you're just in it for the credits. You might run an operation on the side, or you might spend your career moving from settlement to settlement until you get caught in the act.

Choose two attribute boosts. One must be to Intelligence or Charisma, and one is a free attribute boost.

You're trained in the Deception skill and a Lore skill related to a profession or subject you fake expertise in. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.B6HbYsLBWb1RR6Fx]{Charming Liar} skill feat.

feat->Charming Liar.name: Charming Liar
feat->Charming Liar.description: Your charm allows you to win over those you lie to. When you get a critical success using the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie} action, the target's attitude toward you improves by one step, as though you'd succeeded at using Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}. This works only once per conversation, and if you critically succeed against multiple targets using the same result, you choose one creature's attitude to improve. You must be lying to impart seemingly important information, inflate your status, or ingratiate yourself, which trivial or irrelevant lies can't achieve.

class->Witchwarper.name: Witchwarper
class->Witchwarper.description: A strange paradoxical event forever altered your existence, and now you can manipulate reality. You explore the infinite possibilities of the multiverse, possibly visualizing variant timelines or parallel worlds. You create fields that subvert space and time, allowing you to cast powerful magic. You've learned to focus on an anchoring memory, concept, or object to help you identify reality.

weapon->Battleglove.name: Battleglove
weapon->Battleglove.description:
Upgrades: 1

These durable gloves fit over a wielder's hands (or other appendages) and feature weighted plates or spikes over the knuckles.

equipment->Comm Unit.name: Comm Unit
equipment->Comm Unit.description:
A personal comm unit is a pocket-sized device that combines a minor portable computer and a cellular communications device, allowing instantaneous wireless communication with other comm units in both audio- and text-based formats at planetary range. A personal comm unit also includes a calculator, a flashlight (emits bright light in a 5-foot radius around you and dim light in the next 5 feet), a browser that accesses any local infospheres, and several entertainment options (including games).

Personal comm units integrated into armor have some voice-activated capabilities; you can communicate with other comm units in audio-based formats and receive responses without needing a free hand, but typing a message, browsing the infosphere, or using an app requires the use of at least one hand.

Comm units that function at longer ranges aren't as portable; they include built-in generators that provide the necessary amount of power and rely on active Drift beacons to communicate. Short-term use of these units can be purchased in most major settlements.

consumable->Hypopen (Commercial).name: Hypopen (Commercial)
consumable->Hypopen (Commercial).description:
This tiny cylinder contains specialized nanites that either

  • Remove the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} condition
  • Decrease the value of the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition by 1.

consumable->Medpatch (Commercial).name: Medpatch (Commercial)
consumable->Medpatch (Commercial).description:
Activate 1 (manipulate)

Medpatches accelerate the body's natural healing. You regain @Damage[(1d6)[healing]] Hit Points and gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment-effects.Item.VKSOvJQMwUby4fba]{Effect: Medpatch}

backpack->Container (Ordinary).name: Container (Ordinary)
backpack->Container (Ordinary).description: Containers include backpacks, briefcases, duffel bags, and handbags. A container holds up to 4 Bulk and the first 2 Bulk of those items don't count against your Bulk limits. If you're carrying or stowing the container rather than wearing it on your person, its Bulk is light instead of negligible.

armor->Second Skin.name: Second Skin
armor->Second Skin.description:
Upgrades: 0

Soft but resilient fabric contours perfectly to the wearer's body, offering basic protection without sacrificing comfort. Second skin is commonly worn underneath casual clothing.

weapon->Semi-Auto Pistol.name: Semi-Auto Pistol
weapon->Semi-Auto Pistol.description:
Upgrades: 1

This pistol automatically ejects used cartridges and loads new ammunition after every shot fired.

spell->Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
spell->Detect Magic.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies. You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower rank than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment.Item.bikFUFRLwfdvX2x2]{Invisibility Potion}) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the rank or level of the most powerful magical effect the spell detects, as determined by the GM.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd rank, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-rank magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

spell->Stumble.name: Stumble
spell->Stumble.description:
A burst of microgravity causes a tremor around the target, pulling it toward the ground. The target must attempt a Reflex save.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round. If the target was flying, swimming, or floating, it falls 10 feet downward.

Critical Failure The target falls @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If the target was flying, swimming, or floating, it falls 20 feet downward.

Heightened (+1) If the target falls, it falls an additional 5 feet on a failure and 10 feet on a critical failure.

spell->Shifting Surge.name: Shifting Surge
spell->Shifting Surge.description:
You release a surge of magical energy that temporarily changes the type of damage dealt by a weapon. The next Strike the weapon makes deals your choice of acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage and deals an additional 1d6 extra damage of the same type as the weapon's normal damage.
